container-title: In one typical seizure, van Gogh saw every room in the house where he had been born, "every path, every plant in the garden, the views in the fields roundabout . . . down to a magpie's nest in a tall acacia in the graveyard." In 1888 while in a hospital
note: van Gogh painted more expressively than ever before.
title: van Gogh called his seizures "the storm within," and he realized that they were the source of his hallucinations, unprovoked feelings of anger, fear, confusion, and uncontrolled floods of early memories

author.literal: The words "vacuum," "nothing," and "void" usually suggest boring, empty space.

note: These particles are called "virtual particles," and under certain conditions they may separate, become real pairs with positive massenergy, and become part of the observable world.
title: However, to modern quantum physicists, the vacuum of space has turned out to be rich with complex and unexpected behaviors where a state of minimum energy permits quantum fluctuations. These fluctuations can lead to the temporary formation of particle-antiparticle pairs that usually destroy themselves soon after their creation because there is no source of energy to give the pair permanent existence
